Indices and tables

Table of Contents:¶

  • Release Information
  • Installation
  • Administration
  • Integration
  • Developers
  • Release Notes

Release Information¶

  • Release Notes - Information about this release.

Installation¶

  • Installation Guide - The main installation guide.
  • adinstall
  • Advanced Installation Option - Additional, advanced installation options.
  • Kerberos - Describes how to kerberize a Cerebro cluster.
  • LDAP Authentication - For integration of an LDAP service for authentication.
  • OAuth Authentication - For integration of an OAuth service for authentication.
  • DeploymentManager REST Security - Information on how to enable Kerberos for the DeploymentManager API.
  • Cluster Types - Lists all of the supported cluster types and the services they include.

Administration¶

  • Auditing - Describes the audit logging performed by the Cerebro services.
  • Cluster Administration - Explains how to administrate a running Cerebro cluster.
  • Cluster Launch API - For custom cluster launch functionality.
  • Database CLI - This command line tool enables interaction with the Cerebro database.
  • Kubernetes Dashboard Quickstart - Introduction to the Kubernetes dashboard.
  • Web UI - The Cerebro Web UI is explained in detail.

Integration¶

  • Cloudera CDH Integration - How to integrate Cerebro with CDH.
  • Client Integration - How to integrate Cerebro with Hadoop clients.
  • EMR Integration - How to integrate Cerebro with AWS EMR.
  • Tableau Integration - How to integrate Cerebro with Tableau.

Developers¶

  • Authentication - Describes the various client authentication options.
  • Docker Quickstart - For developers, can be used to try out CDAS APIs.
  • Catalog API - Documents the Catalog REST API.
  • Client Configuration - Details about client configuration options.
  • Supported Data Types - Lists the supported data types.
  • Extending CDAS - Introduces the concepts of UDFs and SerDes. Describes S3 permission inheritance.
  • Supported SQL - Describes the Cerebro supported SQL syntax.
  • adinstall
